devdoc.details: Round-based prediction market for token volatility using cUSD ERC20 token

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC-20 token failed.

claimWinnings(uint256[]).details: Claim winnings for settled rounds (Public, Pull-based)

params._roundIds: Array of round IDs to claim winnings for

params._cUSDAddress: Address of the cUSD ERC20 token contract

emergencyWithdraw().details: Emergency withdraw (OnlyOwner) - for stuck cUSD funds

getUserPrediction(uint256,address).details: Get user's prediction for a specific round

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._amount: Amount of cUSD to stake (must be approved beforehand)
params._predictsHigher: True for Higher volatility, false for Lower volatility
params._roundId: The round ID to predict on

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._feeRate: New fee rate in basis points (max 10000 = 100%)

params._riskThreshold: New risk threshold in basis points

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: VolatilityVanguard

claimWinnings(uint256[]).notice: CRITICAL: Fee is transferred to feeReceiver before user payout

placePrediction(uint256,bool,uint256).notice: User must approve this contract to spend cUSD before calling this function

startNewRound().notice: Can only start a new round if:         - No rounds exist yet (currentRoundId == 0), OR         - Current round is settled, OR         - Current round's lockTime has elapsed

userdoc.notice: Uses Inverse Liquidity Pool model with fees taken from losing pool
